description: To the Editor:

title: Commercial Programming reports earnings for Qtr to Sept 30
Chess
description: Two senior Russian grandmasters, Yuri Averbakh, 70 years old, and Mark Taimanov, 66, tied with Nenad Vulicevic of Yugoslavia for first place in the international tournament sponsored by Enhance Financial Services and the Marshall Chess Club in Greenwich Village on Oct. 9 to 18. Each scored 6 1/2-2 1/2, and Vulicevic made his first international master norm.

title: Sewage Bacteria in Food Chain
description: SCIENTISTS have found evidence that organic material from sewage sludge dumped in the deep sea off New Jersey has entered the food chain of bottom-dwelling animals.

title: Irish and British Report the Collapse of Talks
description: Irish and British officials today acknowledged the collapse of nearly two years of talks aimed at a peaceful settlement of the 23 years of civil war in the British province of Northern Ireland.

title: Living Centers of America Inc. reports earnings for Qtr to Sept 30
description: Living Centers' results are stated on a pro forma basis to reflect elimination of operations of previously divested centers; recognition of the effect of the recent public offering as though it occurred on Oct. 1, 1990; and include restatement of interest expense as a result of debt restructuring.

title: Odetics Inc.  reports earnings for Qtr to Sept 30
description: Odetics said that current financial results reflected costs associated with building a manufacturing infrastructure to support anticipated orders for the automated computer mass storage subsystems introduced last year by Odetics' Automated Tape Library Products division.

title: Avoiding Gridlock by Wooing Both Sides of Aisle
description: When President-elect Bill Clinton promised today to cooperate with Congress, saying "Pennsylvania Avenue will run both ways again," his hopes were grander than mere cooperation with the Democratic leaders standing behind him.

title: THE TRANSITION: A New Generation; A Baby-Boom President Young Enough to Be (Gasp!) Me
description: There is a moment of panic in every adult's life when suddenly the airline pilot's voice coming over the intercom sounds less like Chuck Yeager than Dennis the Menace, the doctor seems too young to shave, let alone perform surgery, and the police officer looks like a teen-ager wearing a gun and a badge for Halloween. These intimidations of middle age pale next to the shock of waking up to a Clinton Administration.

title: Steven H. Sanders; Lawyer, 34
description: Steven H. Sanders, a lawyer in Washington who was active with AIDS charities, died Nov. 13 at the Washington Hospital Center. He was 34 years old and lived in Washington.

title: Care Enterprises Inc. reports earnings for Qtr to Sept 30
description: b-Included an $ 882,000 extraordinary gain relating to the reduction of reserves for discontinued operations for both the quarter and 9 months.

title: Bluebeard Has His Day in Court: Not Guilty
description: For generations, if not centuries, the atrocities committed by Gilles de Rais before he was simultaneously hanged and burned in 1440 have served to spook children and to draw tourists to his ruined castles near Nantes in western France.

title: Market Place; When a Company Isn't Forthcoming
description: DESPITE all their efforts at numbers crunching and personal research, investors and analysts are almost slavishly devoted to the public utterings of a company's management. So, when nothing is said, investors usually believe nothing has happened.

title: Will Coleman Star as Mailman II?
description: At Byrne Meadowlands Arena tonight, Derrick Coleman will get his first chance of the season to show Karl Malone that he is developing a new standard by which to judge the power-forward position in the National Basketball Association.

title: Petroleum Heat & Power reports earnings for Qtr to Sept 30
description: The shares outstanding are class A shares.The company is listed on the Nasdaq National Market System.

title: Devils' Brown Waits
description: DOUG BROWN, the first victim of the Devils' overcrowded roster, is not stepping down willingly.

title: Onex Corp. reports earnings for Qtr to Sept 30
description: b-Included a gain of $ 11.7 million from the public offering of shares of Automotive Industries.c-Included income from discontinued operations of $ 1.4 million, or 5 cents a share, in the quarter and $ 1.6 million, or 7 cents a share, in the 9 months.Results are in Canadian dollars.

title: Morgan Keegan Inc.  reports earnings for Qtr to Oct 31
No Contract for Wells
description: The Fukuoka Daiei Hawks said yesterday they would not renew the contract of GREG (BOOMER) WELLS, who became a force in Japan after not making an impact in the majors.

title: No Sign of Plant
description: Four days of intensive searching in the Atlantic Ocean have failed to turn up any signs of MIKE PLANT, the 41-year-old solo sailor who left New York on Oct. 16 on a voyage to France, where he is scheduled to start a round-the-world race next week.

title: Plants Found to Send Nerve-Like Messages
description: PLANTS, unlike animals, have no nerves, so scientists have been jolted by the discovery this month that the tomato plant uses an electric signal to alert its defense system against grazing caterpillars.

title: Kean to Be Host For Soccer Finals
description: Kean College of Union, N.J., was designated by the National Collegiate Athletic Association yesterday as the host institution for the men's Division III Final Four soccer tournament this weekend.

title: Q&A
description: Microwaved Vitamins

title: CHRONICLE
description: MAGIC JOHNSON, who quit the National Commission on AIDS in September, saying that President Bush had "dropped the ball," said during appearances in New York yesterday that he was considering rejoining the commission under the Clinton Administration. According to Reuters, the President-elect has indicated several times that he would like to bring Mr. Johnson back to the commission.

title: Ditka: That Lovable, Sensitive Radio Host
description: So, which is more unsettling: the behavior of MIKE DITKA during a game, or that of the Bears' coach the day after?

title: All Wet on Wetlands
description: Lame-duck Administrations bear watching in their waning days lest they become careless and even reckless. As a case in point, Vice President Dan Quayle and his Council on Competitiveness, which oversees Federal regulation, are considering an act of supreme mischief: loosening the rules that prevent landowners and developers from exploiting America's wetlands.

title: Primark Corp.  reports earnings for Qtr to Sept 30
description: b-Included income from discontinued operations of $ 163,000, or 1 cent a share, in the quarter and $ 999,000, or 5 cents a share, in the 9 months.c-Included losses from discontinued operations of $ 1,668,000 in the quarter and $ 3,588,000 in the 9 months.Latest third quarter included net unrealized losses on equity securities of $ 826,000. These securities were subsequently sold on Nov. 5 for $ 5 million, resulting in a small gain which will be realized in the fourth quarter.The net income figures are before dividends on preferred stock.Share earnings are after payment of preferred stock dividends.

title: Review/Pop; Exile, Icon And Singer Of Protests With Splash
description: Mercedes Sosa demonstrated the art of monument making in her Sunday night appearance at Avery Fisher Hall. Miss Sosa, who is from Argentina, was an originator of nueva cancion, protest music that celebrates opposition movements in Latin America. Exiled for three years in 1979 for criticizing Argentina's military regime, Miss Sosa became an international icon of the left. The story of her survival has become as important to her audiences as the sea-deep power of her singing.

title: Cousins Property reports earnings for Qtr to Sept 30
description: b-Included gains from sale of properties of $ 6.1 million, or 35 cents a share, in the quarter and $ 6.3 million, or 37 cents a share, in the 9 months.c-Included gains from sale of properties of $ 76,000 in the quarter and $ 228,000, or 1 cent a share, in the 9 months.

title: New York Slips in Medical Research, Study Says
description: New York City's competitiveness in biomedical research -- a segment of the health-care industry that provides thousands of highly paid, highly skilled jobs -- is eroding at a worrisome pace, according to a new study and government and private experts.

title: THE TRANSITION: The Republicans; Chastened G.O.P. Leaders, Wary of Intolerant Image, Call for a Party of Inclusion
description: Seeking to distance themselves from the often fractious Presidential campaign, leading Republicans who assembled here set out today to recast their party as one of inclusion.

title: Comarco Inc. reports earnings for Qtr to Nov 1
description: b-Included an extraordinary credit from the repurchase of bonds of $ 4,000.c-Included an extraordinary credit from the repurchase of bonds of $ 9,000 in the quarter and $ 26,000 in the 9 months.The company is listed on the Nasdaq National Market System.

title: Athletic Director Moves
description: After dropping out last week as a candidate at New Mexico, RUDY DAVALOS did an about-face, resigning his post as Houston's athletic director and taking the same job in Alburquerque, N.M.

title:
Books of The Times;
A Tale of Washington at Its Worst
description: Donovan's Wife By Tom Wicker335 pages. Morrow. $22.

title: Classical Music in Review
description: Le Vin Herbe Goliard Ensemble Merkin Concert Hall

title: Philip Morris Plans to Buy Cereal Unit
description: The Philip Morris Companies said yesterday that it planned to acquire RJR Nabisco's North American cold-cereal business for $450 million.

title: AIDS Deaths Tear at Figure-Skating World
description: In the last 12 months, three world- class Canadian figure skaters have died of AIDS. Another Canadian skater, Dennis Coi, a former junior world champion, died in 1987 of the same disease. John Curry of Britain, a former Olympic champion also suffering from AIDS, returned last month to his home in England to spend the remainder of his life.

title: Under Wide Reproach, Serbs Assert Their Culture
description: Religion and culture are undergoing a renaissance here as Serbs throw off the legacy of Tito's era and reach for the sense of nationhood that has repeatedly been denied them over the centuries.

title: Executive Changes
description: BIRD MEDICAL TECHNOLOGIES INC., named John F. Kessler vice president of finance/administration and chief financial officer. DELL COMPUTER CORP., Austin, Tex., named Thomas J. Meredith chief financial officer and L. Scott Flaig senior vice president of worldwide operations responsible for worldwide manufacturing and materials.

title: Analyst and Blow-by-Blow Man: Mismatch Outside the Ropes
description: One of the weirdest aspects of TVKO's 19-month existence -- from Evander Holyfield versus George Foreman to Holyfield versus Riddick Bowe last Friday -- has been the regular announcing team chosen by HBO, the parent of the pay-per-view boxing service: Len Berman of WNBC-TV and trainer Joe Goossen (brother of Greg, the former Mets catcher). Neither is a distinguished boxing commentator, nor is either the caliber of Jim Lampley and Larry Merchant, who call HBO's regular slate of bouts and quite clearly belong on TVKO's schedule.

title: Insurance Bill Moves Ahead In New Jersey
description: In a step toward major changes in health insurance, the New Jersey Assembly today approved a bill intended to help uninsured people buy private policies.

title: U.S. Joins Airline in Plan for Settlement in 1990 Crash
description: In its first public acknowledgement of any liability for the Avianca Airlines crash on Long Island that killed 73 people in 1990, the Federal Government today joined Avianca in a preliminary out-of-court settlement intended to apportion financial responsibility.

title: Salvadoran Government Invents Excuses to Maintain Iron Grip
description: To the Editor:

title: Observer; By Sex Obsessed
description: In the military you met all kinds. That's one of the things that made it such valuable experience. It was an eye-opener for young people who had never rubbed elbows with any but their own sort.

title: Police Groups Assail Release Of Statements on Slain Officer
description: After a slain police officer was buried yesterday in Queens, the head of a police fraternal organization criticized the Police Department for releasing information at a news conference last week indicating that the officer had had sex shortly before her death with one of the men accused of killing her.

title: CNN News Co-Anchor To Be '20/20' Reporter
description: Catherine Crier, a co-anchor of CNN's evening news, will join the ABC News program "20/20" as a correspondent in early 1993, it was announced yesterday by Roone Arledge, the president of ABC.

title: By Design; New Way With Pearls
description: Along with the Republican Administration, chokers of Barbara Bush-size pearls are on the way out. But pearls are definitely still in.

title: Teaching About Gay Life Is Pressed by Chancellor
description: In another round in their battle over whether to teach children about homosexuals, Schools Chancellor Joseph A. Fernandez told a defiant Queens school board yesterday that its anti-bias curriculum still did not teach youngsters to respect gay people. He said he would dispatch an emissary from his office to help the board comply.

title: A Soldier in the Data Base Wars
description: THE MICROSOFT CORPORATION introduced its long-awaited Access data base management program here yesterday, filling one of the last major gaps in the software giant's product line.

title: 'Cleaner' Dry Cleaning Test
description: "I would like to air some dirty laundry to the press," William K. Reilly, the Administrator of the Environmental Protection Agency, told reporters at a news conference today. And he meant it.

title: Challenge of Access for the Disabled at Worship
description: A new symbol has joined the cross, the crescent and the Star of David on America's houses of worship: a stick figure in a wheelchair.

title: Grenade Tossed Into Arab Market In Jerusalem Kills a Palestinian
description: A Palestinian was killed and 11 other Arabs were wounded today when a grenade was tossed into an Arab market in the Old City. The police said the grenade was apparently thrown from a Jewish enclave overlooking the market.

title: Knicks Starting to Discover Tiny Problem: Too Few Points
description: The Knicks may have traveled across the country, but they did not leave their offensive problems behind.

title: Patterns
description: De la Renta: Busy, Busy

title: Blue Jays Staff Intact
description: The World Series champion Toronto Blue Jays announced yesterday that their entire coaching staff would return for the 1993 season.

title: Removal of Drums of Chemicals Ordered at Warehouse Fire Site
description: City environmental officials yesterday ordered the removal of a large stock of chemicals from a Brooklyn warehouse destroyed in a suspicious, five-alarm fire Sunday night, but said the chemicals were secure in drums, not flammable or especially toxic and posed no hazard to the surrounding Bushwick neighborhood.

title: Guides Set For S.& L. Officials
description: Savings and loan regulators issued guidelines today governing the responsibilities of savings and loan officers despite the objections of enforcement officials who fear the new rules will make it harder to recover damages from negligent executives and directors.

title: Aspirin and Reye's
description: To the Editor:

title: Repaired Masterpiece Redisplayed
description: After a cleaning disputed by art experts and a dramatic accident that left five gashes in its canvas, Veronese's "Marriage at Cana," one of the Louvre's greatest treasures, was returned to public display yesterday. It is now the centerpiece of a Veronese exhibition that the unveiling inaugurated with much fanfare.

title: Buenos Aires Journal; The Days Dwindle Down to Poverty and Suicide
description: In the early morning of Aug. 20, an impoverished 73-year-old woman hanged herself from a tree outside the University of Buenos Aires Law School. Since then, the police have reported a series of suicides among those 65 and older in and around the capital, with many leaving notes behind saying their economic condition was so bleak they could not cope.

title: Ex-Head of Bloomingdale's Purchases Conran Stores
description: Almost a year after he retired as chairman of Bloomingdale's, Marvin Traub is back in the retail business, this time as an owner.

title: COMPANY NEWS
description: ELI LILLY & CO., Indianapolis, and Ranbaxy Laboratories Ltd., of New Delhi have signed an agreement to establish a joint venture to sell and market Lilly products in India.

title: Andreychuk Suspended
description: DAVE ANDREYCHUK of the Buffalo Sabres was suspended for two non-game days without pay yesterday by the National Hockey League president, GIL STEIN, for cross-checking Rangers defenseman JEFF BEUKEBOOM in the jaw on Nov. 2.

title: Navy Fails in New Attempt to Exclude Gay Sailor
description: Four days after being forced by a Federal judge to readmit a sailor it discharged after he declared his homosexuality on national television, the Navy failed today to get the judge to reverse his order and exclude the sailor from duty while his lawsuit against the Navy is pending.

title: Holnam Inc. reports earnings for Qtr to Sept 30
Corrections
description: A picture caption on Friday with a rock review misidentified the guitarist shown. He was Marty Friedman of Megadeth.

title: Hadson Corp. reports earnings for Qtr to Sept 30
description: Hadson said that its latest third quarter results reflected interest charges related to the long-term debt which it is currently restructuring through its prepackaged bankruptcy.

title: Classical Music in Review
description: New York Festival of Song Weill Recital Hall

title: Yankees Get Ready to Play A Headache-Sized Shell Game
description: The Yankees spent yesterday trying to guess which players the Colorado Rockies and the Florida Marlins will choose in the expansion draft today. Executives in the Bronx pored over lists of available players, including their own, and staged mock drafts so that they would be ready for anything this afternoon in Manhattan. Well, almost anything.

title: New York Specializes in Duplicated Agencies
description: To the Editor:

title: Time Inc. Names New No. 2 Editor
description: Continuing the transition to a new generation of leaders, Time Inc. yesterday named Henry Muller, managing editor of Time magazine, to the No. 2 editorial management position in the company.

title: Baltek Corp. reports earnings for Qtr to Sept 30
description: b-Included non-recurring loss of $ 377,519 for operating and personnel changes.c-Net incomeThe company is listed on the Nasdaq National Market System.

title: LITHUANIANS OUST GOVERNING PARTY
description: Lithuanian voters angry at economic difficulties and cold apartments have repudiated the Sajudis movement that brought them independence, giving a party of former Communists a working majority in a new Parliament.

title: International Telecharge Inc.  reports earnings for Qtr to Sept 30
description: b-Net lossInternational Telecharge said that latest third-quarter results reflected the initial quarter of its services agreement with Oncor Communications Inc.

title: 3 Shot in Grocery Holdup
description: The owner of a Harlem grocery was shot to death last night and two of his customers wounded in what police described as a botched holdup. Detective Joseph K. McConville, a police spokesman, said the three were in the store at 139th Street and Edgecombe Avenue about 9:10 P.M. when two gunmen wearing ski masks burst in and announced a robbery. When the owner, Henry A. Medina, 48 years old, of Teaneck, moved toward the cash register, the intruders fired, killing him instantly. The two wounded men were taken to Harlem Hospital, where a spokeswoman said one victim underwent surgery last night.

title: EquiVest Inc. reports earnings for Qtr to Sept 30
description: b-Net incomeYear-ago share earnings are after preferred dividends of $ 62,500 in the quarter and $ 131,944 in the 9 months.

description: b-Included charge of $ 22,172,000 related to restructuring and other items.c-Included charge of $ 2,012,000 and $ 33,398,000 for the quarter and 9 months, respectively, both related to restructuring and other items.

title: Cadema Corp. reports earnings for Qtr to Sept 30
description: b-Net incomeCadema said that the figures included the results of a newly acquired subsidiary for the period July 15 to Sept. 30, 1992.The company is listed on the Nasdaq Small Cap.

title: Designs Inc. reports earnings for Qtr to Oct 31
description: The company is listed on the Nasdaq National Market System.

title: Israel's Likud Puts Hope in U.S.-Style Changes
description: Battered at the polls and riddled with dissension, Israel's once-dominant Likud Party began today to try rebuilding itself by openly embracing American-style electoral changes.

title: A U.S. Spy Satellite May Be Sold Abroad
description: THE United Arab Emirates is shopping in the United States for a spy satellite, raising tough new questions about the intersection of economic and national security needs at a time when military contractors are hungry for work after the cold war.

title: End Is Urged To Duty on Flat Screens
description: The only American company actively selling an advanced type of flat-panel computer display screen has abruptly reversed its position and asked the Commerce Department to cancel immediately the nation's punitive taxes on imports of the screens.

title: Acme-Cleveland Corp. reports earnings for Year to Sept 30
description: b-Included an extraordinary credit of $ 1,700,000, or 26 cents a share.c-Net loss and after a loss from discontinued operations of $ 6,035,000.

title: Healthvest reports earnings for Qtr to Sept 30
description: b-Net income

title: Black Theater to Resume Production
description: The Negro Ensemble Company, which announced in July that it would have to close by the end of 1992, has won a reprieve.

title: Defense Presses Hard In the Glen Ridge Case
description: The four defense lawyers in the Glen Ridge sex assault trial are working as a team, but when they take on prosecution witnesses, each attacks from a different angle.

title: EnviroSource Inc. reports earnings for Qtr to Sept 30
description: The company is listed on the Nasdaq National Market System.

title: Proffitt's Inc. reports earnings for Qtr to Oct 31
COMPANY NEWS: Saved by the Click; Telephone Gadget Offers Polite Escape
description: To Miss Manners, also known as Judith Martin, call waiting is "incredibly rude." To Letitia Baldridge, another etiquette expert, it is "an instrument of the Devil." But to David H. Schmidt, budding entrepreneur, it can be a polite way of easing out of a phone call that has dragged on for too long.

title: Sharpton Appeal Rebuffed
description: The Supreme Court refused today, without comment, to hear a challenge by the Rev. Al Sharpton to his prosecution on charges of state tax fraud and failing to file New York State tax returns. Mr. Sharpton was acquitted of related charges by a New York City jury in a 1990 trial, but he faces a trial in Albany. He has failed to persuade a series of state and Federal courts that the second prosecution violates his Fifth Amendment protection against double jeopardy.

title: He's Now Knick, but Will He Play?
description: The Knicks' pursuit of a backup big man ended Sunday when they signed Herb Williams. But two important questions remain: How much will Williams help, and how much will he play?

title: BISHOPS MAY AVOID STAND ON WOMEN
description: The nation's Roman Catholic bishops gathered here today to take a stand on a long-awaited pastoral letter on women in society and the church, but it was far from certain that the document they have been working on for nine years will actually come to a vote.

title: Corrections
description: An article and a caption on Sunday about the relationship between the former Chief Judge of the New York State Court of Appeals, Sol Wachtler, and Joy A. Silverman, an influential Republican fund raiser, misidentified the town in which Mrs. Silverman's boyfriend, David Samson, lives. It is Roseland, N.J.

title: DAIMLER-BENZ ANNOUNCES ADDITIONAL LAYOFFS
description: Daimler-Benz A.G., Germany's largest industrial group, announced yesterday a steep drop in earnings and thousands of new layoffs. Daimler, the maker of Mercedes-Benz cars and trucks, announced that its earnings were likely to drop by about $253 million to about $949 million this year. The company also said it plans to eliminate an additional 7,500 jobs by the end of 1994. Combined with previously announced measures, that would bring total job losses to 27,500. At the end of 1991, Daimler had 380,000 employees worldwide.

title: How to Protect Baltic Minorities
description: President Boris Yeltsin of Russia has renewed "unequivocally" his pledge to withdraw all Russian troops still based in the Baltic republics. That's welcome news if it is not undercut by two other developments.

title: U.N. Tightens Curbs on Belgrade By Authorizing a Naval Blockade
description: The Security Council voted tonight to impose a naval blockade against Yugoslavia, for the first time adding enforcement provisions to trade sanctions that were adopted against the Serbian-led Belgrade Government in May.

title: WAL-MART PLANS TO OPEN 155 MORE STORES WITHIN YEAR
description: Wal-Mart Stores Inc. plans to open 155 stores this fiscal year, the company's chief financial officer, Paul R. Carter, said yesterday. Speaking at an industry conference in Baltimore, Mr. Carter said Wal-Mart also planned to expand 91 existing stores and relocate 69 others. Of these 69 stores, he said, 24 will be supercenters. The company also plans to open 48 Sam's Clubs stores this year. In its 1993 fiscal year, the company plans to open an additional 155 stores while expanding or relocating 100 stores, Mr. Carter said.

title: New York State Judge Sets Hearing on Clifford's Health
description: A judge yesterday scheduled a hearing for Dec. 9 to take testimony from doctors before deciding whether Clark M. Clifford, adviser to several Presidents, is too ill to stand trial in New York State on charges stemming from the Bank of Credit and Commerce International scandal.

title: Boon to Anglers Turns Into a Disaster for Lakes and Streams
description: BIOLOGISTS have long catalogued and mourned the havoc that exotic animals can wreak when moved into habitats where native species have evolved few defenses against them. Grim stories abound, from the sharp decline of bluebirds in the United States due to competition from imported English house sparrows and starlings to the devastation of tortoises on the Galapagos by introduced pigs, cats and dogs who prey on the eggs and young.

title: Advanced Medical Inc. reports earnings for Qtr to Sept 30
description: b-Included an extraordinary charge from the early extinguishment of debt of $ 8,898,000.

title: RESULTS PLUS
description: N.H.L. Canadiens Stun Bruins

title: Janice G. Fulton, A Bridge Champion, Is Presumed Dead
description: Janice Gilbert Fulton, a bridge expert and game-show personality in the early days of television, was presumed dead after a boating accident last week near her home about 150 miles north of Haiti, her lawyer said yesterday.

title: Flat Economy Foreseen For Western Germany
description: The German council of economic advisers predicted today that the western German economy would slump to zero growth in 1993.

title: 2 Retailers Post Gains In Earnings
description: The Kmart Corporation, the discount and specialty store chain, reported yesterday that a program of renovating and enlarging its discount stores paid off in increases of about 12 percent in profits and sales in its third quarter.

title: Lomas Financial reports earnings for Qtr to Sept 30
description: b-After a loss from discontinued operations of $ 4,578,000.The company said share earnings and shares outstanding are neither mearningful nor comparable.

title: U.S. Bishops Discuss Women
description: The nation's Roman Catholic bishops opened a meeting in Washington to take a stand on a long-awaited pastoral letter on women. Page A16.

title: Marsh Supermarkets reports earnings for Qtr to Oct 10
description: The company is listed on the Nasdaq National Market System.

title: Fritz Cos. reports earnings for Qtr to Sept 30
description: Revenue represented net revenues.The company said the net income and per-share figures are provided on a pro forma basis, assuming the company had not elected S Corp. status for income tax purposes.The company is listed on the Nasdaq National Market System.

title: A Sure Sign Of Winter: Bills on Top
description: Seeking to avoid their first sweep by the Miami Dolphins in six years, seeking to avenge an embarrassing 37-10 loss to the Dolphins in Buffalo in Week 5 and hungry for sole possession of first place in the American Conference East division, the Buffalo Bills claimed all three goals tonight, rallying in the second half for a 26-20 victory over Miami before 70,629 fans in Joe Robbie Stadium.

title: Securities Group Expels 6
description: The National Association of Securities Dealers said today that it had it expelled six member firms and barred, fined or suspended a number of individual members.

title: Tiffany's Sales and Profits Decline Sharply
description: Tiffany & Company announced yesterday that its sales and profits were sharply lower in the third quarter, and it attributed the declines to the slowing Japanese economy.

title: Rockies and Marlins Dive Into a 26-Team Pool
description: The Colorado Rockies began with a list of 3,028 prospective players and have slashed it to under 400. The Florida Marlins entered the final stage of their strategic planning with a list not half that long.

title: Review/Pop; Questioning One's Life While Firmly Cherishing It
description: From the moment Holly Golightly first had breakfast at Tiffany's, the gamin has been a common stereotype for arty urban women. The gamin combines sassiness with vulnerability. Like most cliched roles, this one can be confining, but Shawn Colvin took it in a slightly new direction with her Bottom Line appearance on Thursday night.

title: Covington Development reports earnings for Qtr to Sept 30
description: b-Included a gain of $ 624,000 from the transfer of property in lieu of amounts owed.c-Included a gain of $ 688,000 related to the repayment of debt.

title: Sea Containers reports earnings for Qtr to Sept 30
description: Share earnings and shares outstanding reflected a 2-for-1 stock split of July 5.The latest periods' results are after payment of preferred dividends of $ 4.046 million in the quarter and $ 12.146 million in the 9 months, compared with $ 3.944 million and $ 9.357 million in the year-ago periods, respectively.

title: M.D.C. Holdings reports earnings for Qtr to Sept 30
description: b-Included an extraordinary loss of $ 47,000 from the early extinguishment of debt in the quarter; the 9 months included loss of $ 2,491,000 from early extinguishment of debt and a gain of $ 1,700,000, or 8 cents a share, from accounting change.c-Included extraordinary income of $ 5,330,000, or 24 cents a share, from the early extinguishment of debt in the quarter; the 9 months included extraordinary items of $ 14,262,000, or 68 cents a share, which included a $ 5.3 million extraordinary after-tax gain in connection with the transfer of properties in satisfaction of certain non-recourse notes payable and $ 8.9 million in extraordinary after-tax gains from the company's repurchase of $ 20.9 million principal amount of its senior subordinated and subordinated notes.

title: Supreme Court Roundup; Hazardous-Waste Ruling Overturned
description: At the Bush Administration's urging, the Supreme Court today overturned a Federal appeals court's decision requiring cities to treat the ash from municipal incinerators as hazardous waste rather than ordinary waste that can be deposited cheaply in a landfill.

title: Robec Inc. reports earnings for Qtr to Sept 30
description: b-Net incomeThe company is listed on the Nasdaq National Market System.

title: Sportscene Restaurants reports earnings for Year to Aug 30
description: Results are in Canadian dollars.The company said its 1991 results included net earnings of 15 cents a share, from discontinued operations. The full amount was not disclosed.

title: Fund Drive Successful, Morgan Library Says
description: A four-year, $40 million fund-raising drive by the Pierpont Morgan Library has ended successfully, the library's director has announced. Charles E. Pierce Jr., the director, said the money raised from trustees, foundations and friends has been used to renovate the library and augment its endowment, as well as to buy and renovate the adjacent Morgan mansion.

title: Addington Resources reports earnings for Qtr to Sept 30
description: b-Net loss and after a loss from an accounting adjustment of $ 3,500,000.The company is listed on the Nasdaq National Market System.The company said it recorded, in the third quarter, an after-tax gain of $ 2.4 million, or 16 cents a share, for the sale of certain West Virginia coal reserves.Coal operating profit in the current quarter was $ 4.5 million, up from $ 4.3 million a year ago. The company also said 1991 third-quarter net income was affected by a $ 1.6 million after-tax loss resulting from high operating costs at two coal mines in western Kentucky that have since been closed, and by a $ 300,000 gain from the sale of its Addington Contracting Inc. unit.

title: On My Mind; The Anatomy of Hate
description: The first conference was held in 1990 in Oslo, a place of peace and civility. The second was in Moscow a year later, when Communism was in its last few days and hope in its first.

title: Short-Term Treasury Prices Fall
description: Prices of Treasury bills and notes took a beating yesterday in thin but volatile trading as investors and traders continued to sell shorter-term maturities.

title: GATT Chief in U.S. Talks
description: Arthur Dunkel, the Secretary General of the General Agreement on Tariffs and Trade, the 105-nation group that sets international free-trade rules, met here today with Agriculture Secretary Edward R. Madigan and Carla A. Hills, the United States trade representative, to review ways to revive world trade talks aimed at lowering global trade barriers.

title: The Economy Still Needs a Prod
description: With an uptick here and a rosy look there, the economy gives faint signs of revival, raising sensible doubts. If things are looking up, should the new Clinton Administration continue to plan for a temporary burst of Federal stimulation? The answer, in a word, is yes; the signs of revival may be, in a word, false.

title: Dr. Joseph Druss, 94, Authority on the Ear
description: Dr. Joseph George Druss, an ear, nose and throat specialist associated with Mount Sinai School of Medicine for more than six decades, died on Saturday at Mount Sinai Hospital. He was 94 years old and lived in Manhattan.

title: Thompson Shifts Kellogg Account
description: J. Walter Thompson U.S.A. said yesterday that it had shifted responsibility for its Kellogg Company account, worth an estimated $35 million to $40 million, to its New York office after 12 years at its Chicago office.

title: Intertape Polymer Group reports earnings for Qtr to Sept 30
description: Results are in Canadian dollars.

title: American International Petroleum Corp. reports earnings for Qtr to Sept 30
description: b-Included a $ 913,000 loss from the sale of its domestic oil and gas operations.The company is listed on the Nasdaq National Market System.

title: Prison Terms for 2 Ex-Officers in Drug Ring
description: Two former New York City police officers were sentenced today to prison terms for their roles in a cocaine ring that prosecutors said also involved other city police officers.

title: First Black Candidate Loses In Election for Mayor in Rio
description: Rio's first black candidate for mayor narrowly lost the race despite a national surge in support for her leftist party, election results showed today.

title: Drafting the 'New Media' Into Public Service Campaigns
description: "SMOKEY BEAR: concerned citizen or pyromaniacal busybody? On the next 'Donahue.' "

title: Schering Work Goes to McAdams
description: Schering-Plough's health care division said yesterday that it had moved its Gyne-Lotrimin and Gyne-Moistrin accounts, with billings estimated at $23 million, to William Douglas McA dams in New York after two years at Cadwell Davis Partners in New York.

title: Review/Music; Magritte Inspires A Concert Program
description: The title of the American Symphony Orchestra's first program of the season at Avery Fisher Hall, "Surrealism and Music?," was suitably cautious, and Leon Botstein, the orchestra's music director, began a preconcert talk by stressing the question mark. The notion of Surrealism sits oddly on an art form little given to realism in the first place.

title: From Karan, Underwear to Be Seen
description: Bras, which were erroneously reported burned during the women's liberation movement of the 1960's, are in the fashion news again. A few years ago, Madonna began wearing Jean-Paul Gaultier bras as outerwear. Now, in the fashion collections for spring 1993, shown earlier this month, as fabrics have grown thinner and more transparent, undergarments have become almost an obligatory part of the fashion picture.

title: Short-Term Stimulus? Long-Term Error.
description: The country has just endured a wrenching recession, modest growth has resumed but employment remains stubbornly high. The nation rejects its President in favor of a voice for change. With inflation seemingly under control, the new occupant of the White House announces a formidable $30 billion program to stimulate the economy.

title: Geodyne Resources reports earnings for Qtr to Sept 30
description: b-Net income

title: Total Research reports earnings for Qtr to Sept 30
U.S. BACKS MERGER OF NORTHWEST AIR AND DUTCH CARRIER
description: In a thrust aimed at opening the skies above the United States and Europe to more international competition, the Transportation Department yesterday approved a request by Northwest Airlines and KLM Royal Dutch Airlines to merge and function as one airline and to cooperate in crucial areas like pricing and strategy.

title: Commissioner Orders an Overhaul In Fight Against Police Corruption
description: Stung by an avalanche of criticism over police corruption and the apparently flawed controls for rooting it out, Police Commissioner Raymond W. Kelly yesterday ordered sweeping changes in his department's structure and methods for investigating and exposing corrupt officers.

title: Is He In or Out?
description: Though Coach JERRY BERNDT has heard a lot about his future, or lack of it, with the Temple Owls next season, it hasn't come from the people who will make the decision.

title: Plan to Abandon New Jersey Network Dies
description: Stunned by an outpouring of support for the New Jersey Network's preservation as the voice of the state and the realization that turning it over to another operator would be fiscally unsound, the New Jersey Assembly voted overwhelmingly today to scuttle a plan to abandon the television system, and restored most of its financing.

title: Dr. Peter Jepson-Young, 35, Dies; Educated Canadians About AIDS
description: Dr. Peter Jepson-Young, a physician who helped fight stereotypes and misunderstandings about AIDS in frank television discussions of his own battle against the disease, died on Sunday in Vancouver. He was 35 years old.

title: AOI Coal reports earnings for Qtr to Sept 30
description: b-Net loss

title: Hanoi Backs Study To Trace M.I.A's
description: Members of a Senate panel investigating the fate of Americans missing from the Vietnam War hailed what they said today was a new spirit of cooperation from Vietnam and suggested strongly that President Bush might soon relax an economic embargo against the Hanoi Government.

title: A Book, of Sorts, in Your Pocket
description: IMAGINE a device that weighs less than five ounces, slips into a shirt pocket and contains the equivalent of two books, each of which can be as long as 10 Bibles. This is not a science-fiction movie prop. It is the Digital Book System from Franklin Electronic Publishers of Mount Holly, N.J.

title: Data Show G.M. Knew for Years Of Risk in Pickup Trucks' Design
description: The General Motors Corporation recognized as long ago as 1983 that its pickup trucks could be made "much less vulnerable" to collisions that might break open their fuel tanks, according to company documents that have just come to light. But the company did not change the trucks' design until the 1988 model year.

title: Spain's Progress Turns to Pain
description: It was called the Spanish miracle, but might have been more prosaically described as Europe's galvanization of Spain. For five years after joining the European Community in 1986, the country sped ahead, spurred by huge foreign investment, new competition and a revival of national energy after the long isolation of the Franco years.

title: Classical Music in Review
description: Thomas Hampson Baritone Carnegie Hall

title: Why Exempt Police From Residency Law?
description: To the Editor:

title: Keep Politics Alive
description: While we celebrate the improved voter turnout in this election, we should also recognize that the public's intense disaffection with politics and politicians will not disappear overnight. We no longer can afford to rely on a periodic binge of frenzied Presidential campaigning to wake people up once every four years.

title: Jay Spectre, 63; An Interior Designer Of Luxurious Homes
description: Jay Spectre, a New York-based interior and furniture designer, died yesterday at his house in New Canaan, Conn. He was 63 years old.

title: Accounts
description: * Paddington Corp., Fort Lee, N.J., said yesterday that it had placed in review its Amaretto di Saronno liqueur account, with billings of $3.5 million, confirming reports this week in Advertising Age and Adweek. A spokeswoman said the incumbent agency, Grace & Rothschild , New York, had been invited to participate, but declined to disclose other participants. * Virgin Retail, Los Angeles, to D'Arcy Masius Benton & Bowles , Los Angeles, to introduce the company's first American Virgin Megastore record store, opening in Los Angeles next month. Billings were not disclosed.

title: The Giants Still Have Hope, and Hostetler
description: Less than 24 hours after Sunday night's loss in Denver, Ray Handley had to look at the brighter side of things today. He still has a quarterback, and he still has a football team teetering uneasily in contention.

title: Strober Organization reports earnings for Qtr to Sept 30
description: b-Net lossc-Included tax benefits of $ 72,000 in the quarter and $ 651,000 in the 9 months.The company is listed on the Nasdaq National Market System.

description: b-Net incomeThe company is listed on the Nasdaq National Market System.

title: Cold Fusion, Derided in U.S., Is Hot In Japan
description: HIDEO IKEGAMI was directing a Japanese research project in nuclear fusion in 1989 when news came from the United States that two scientists at the University of Utah claimed to have produced the phenomenon in a jar. When Japan's Ministry of Education asked him to divert 10 percent of his project's budget to support researchers wanting to explore the new "cold fusion," Dr. Ikegami refused.

title: New Clue to Vision: People Whose Glasses Must Be Rose-Colored
description: FRANCES FUTTERMAN'S office has a cozy afterhours feel to it even first thing in the morning. She keeps the windows shuttered, leaving just a couple of slats slightly agape to let in a dapple of sun. The lights are turned low, and fuzzy throw-rugs cover floor and furniture alike, to absorb glare and soothe the eye.

title: Todd Shipyards reports earnings for Qtr to Sept 27
description: b-Included an extraordinary tax credit of $ 144,000, or 1 cent a share, in the quarter and $ 552,000, or 5 cents a share, in the 6 months.c-Included an extraordinary tax credit of $ 4,831,000, or 40 cents a share, in the quarter and $ 6,856,000, or 57 cents a share, in the 6 months.The company said the decrease in net income for the quarter was mainly due to a nonrecurring $ 8 million contract reserve reversal and a $ 6.9 million gain from a litigation settlement, both of which were recorded in the year-ago period. In the year-ago 9 months period, there was a $ 12 million reversal of the contract, plus the previously mentioned gain from the litigation.

title: What Galileo Actually Proved and Disproved; An Unnecessary Rift
description: To the Editor:

title: CHRONICLE
description: Whither the beleaguered Windsors? In the last week, the London tabloids have had a field day reporting that A) a tape recording has surfaced in which PRINCE CHARLES professes his love for his old girlfriend Lady CAMILLA PARKER BOWLES, B) the PRINCESS OF WALES spent her husband's 44th birthday not by his side but in France and C) the couple have agreed to an informal separation.

title: Aides Say Appointee Urged Searches of Clinton's File
description: A top political appointee at the State Department encouraged Congressional Republicans to request information from Bill Clinton's passport files in an apparent effort to justify opening them late in the Presidential campaign, Administration officials said today.

title: Clues Etched in Bone Debunk Theory of a Plague's Spread
description: AMONG human bones from pre-Columbian America and Europe, scientists are finding distinctive scars, some like the patterns in worm-eaten wood, that could be decisive clues in one of the enduring mysteries of medical history: Where did syphilis originate, and how and why did it erupt with epidemic virulence in Europe at the end of the 15th century?

title: Sports of The Times; Hurricanes Seeing Orange
description: IF we believe everything we hear, then yesterday was the first time that Syracuse University football players and coaches began thinking about Saturday's game at the Carrier Dome against undefeated Miami.

title: Rubbermaid Chairman Quits Posts
description: Rubbermaid Inc., the household products company, said Walter F. Williams, its chairman of 18 months, had resigned over the weekend, citing personal reasons. Mr. Williams will be replaced on an interim basis by Stanley C. Gault, who retired as Rubbermaid's chairman last year but later returned to work as chairman of the Goodyear Tire and Rubber Company.

title: Rexene Corp.  reports earnings for Qtr to Sept 30
description: b-Included gain of $ 123,672,000 for debt forgiveness under Chapter 11 reorganization plan in the quarter and 9 months, and also included charges of $ 31,845,000 in the quarter and $ 38,514,000 in the 9 months for reorganization costs.c-Net loss and included charges of $ 2,395,000 in the quarter and $ 9,786,000 in the 9 months, for debt restructuring costs.

title: Cricket's Swan Song
description: It is built like a cricket's ear. It even hears like a cricket's ear. But this ear belongs to a fly.

title: What Galileo Actually Proved and Disproved
description: To the Editor:

title: Colorado Issue By Power Agency
description: The Platte River Power Authority in Colorado is offering $114.53 million of tax-exempt power revenue bonds priced to yield a maximum 6.33 percent for an issue that matures in 2018. For investors in a 28 percent tax bracket, the equivalent taxable yield would be about 8.79 percent, and for those in the 31 percent bracket, 9.17 percent.

title: Critic's Notebook; With a Nip and a Tuck, TV Imitates Life
description: Based-on-fact movies have become a television hazard, generating a legal mini-industry skilled at scouring headlines and securing exclusive story rights. Apart from the moral questions of sometimes rewarding criminals with lucrative contracts, the genre has encouraged artistic laziness. Creativity has given way to paint-by-the-numbers reality rip-offs, pieced together from news articles, interviews and court transcripts. The formula has already become numbing.

title: METRO DIGEST
description: NEW YORK CITY CHANGES ORDERED IN POLICE MONITORING

title: Review/Theater; Rockettes And Elves: Christmas Is Near
description: One deer a-sleighing, two skaters skating, three lumpy camels, two mighty organs and one Santa Claus. Not to mention 60 years' tradition, 72 legs a-kicking, 100 cast members and a horde of happy fans. Yes, "The Christmas Spectacular" is back, off on a 179-performance run that is expected to pull a million people into Radio City Music Hall before it ends on Jan. 6.

title: Attorney General Finds Evidence To Further Iraq Bank-Fraud Case
description: Attorney General William P. Barr told lawmakers today that he would go ahead with the first step toward the appointment of an independent counsel to investigate the Government's role in a multimillion-dollar bank fraud case involving Iraq.

title: Business Scene; Clinton Faces Deflation Worries
description: GLEAMING, frostless refrigerators are a staple in millions of American homes. So are modern cooking ranges, dishwashers and air-conditioners. Yet the prices of these ubiquitous household appliances have been falling since 1989, reversing a decades-old trend toward higher prices -- and creating one of the pockets of deflation that keep appearing in these hard times.

title: New Catechism for Catholics Defines Sins of Modern World
description: For the first time in more than four centuries, the Roman Catholic Church today issued a new universal catechism, a massive compendium of its teachings that reaffirms traditional tenets of faith but also identifies a range of new sins that are products of modern-day society.

title: Opponents of Panamanian Chief Say He Must Shift Course or Quit
description: Panamanians who led the victorious campaign against a series of constitutional changes indicated today that the pressure is now on President Guillermo Endara either to make major changes in his Government or step aside early.

title: INSIDE
description: Emirates Seek Spy Satellite

title: THE TRANSITION: The President-Elect; Clinton and Top Legislators Pledge Amity on Economy
description: President-elect Bill Clinton gathered Democratic leaders around him today to pronounce an end to the "cold war" between Congress and the White House. But Mr. Clinton quickly confronted the degree to which his campaign pledges strain the coalition he will need to enact his programs.

title: Corrections
description: A picture caption on Friday about a City Council hearing on the killing of Yankel Rosenbaum last year in Crown Heights, Brooklyn, misidentified the man at the center. He was Councilman Stanley E. Michels.

title: IGI Inc. reports earnings for Qtr to Sept 30
Energy Ventures reports earnings for Qtr to Sept 30
description: b-Included income from discontinued operations of $ 8,000 in the quarter and $ 36,000 in the 9 months.c-Included income from discontinued operations of $ 29,000 and $ 51,000 for the quarter and 9 months, respectively.The company is listed on the Nasdaq National Market System.

title: Microsoft and Software's Slow Pace
description: The slow pace of software design has become a big stumbling block in the personal computer business.

title: Toys 'R' Us Inc.  reports earnings for Qtr to Oct 31
HAL Inc. reports earnings for Qtr to Sept 30
description: b-Included a gain of $ 2,169,000, or 46 cents a share, on the early extinguishment of debt. Before that gain, operating net was $ 23,794,000, or $ 5.01 a share in the quarter and the 9 months included a gain of $ 2,169,000, or 65 cents a share, on the early extinguishment of debt, and a gain of $ 2,192,000, or 66 cents a share, on an accounting change, and both the quarter and 9 months included a pretax gain of $ 41,711,000 on route sales.c-Net lossd-Included a gain of pretax $ 9 million on route sales.

title: I.B.M. Introduces Its Series Of Voice-Activated Products
description: I.B.M. moved a step closer yesterday to a time when humans and computers will converse by announcing a series of products that allow people to operate computers by speaking to them rather than typing in commands or moving a mouse.

title: U.N. CHIEF DETAILS PLAN ON OVERHAUL
description: Secretary General Boutros Boutros-Ghali has announced new initiatives in his plan to restructure the United Nations.

title: Mets Will Twiddle Thumbs, and Then Pursue an Arm
description: The Mets, who had reason to believe they could complete a trade for a pitcher before rosters were frozen last week, remain hopeful of sealing one of their potential deals soon after today's expansion draft at the Marriott Marquis Hotel in Manhattan.

title: 'Gypsy Passion' Flows From Diplomat's Revolt
description: Tomas Rodriguez-Pantoja had been a diplomat for years when he decided one day to cast his lot with the Gypsies. Mr. Pantoja is the librettist and director of "Gypsy Passion," the flamenco revue that opens tonight at the Plymouth Theater on Broadway. The show, which played at Town Hall in April to critical and popular acclaim, offers an affectionate overview of the lives, music and dance of the Andalusian Gypsies who perform in it. It is the work of a man who long admired the Gypsy philosophy of life that inspired his change of heart.

title: Fleet Down After Report
description: Shaes of Fleet Financial Group Inc. fell as much as 4.4 percent today after a CBS television broadcast reported charges that its mortgage lending practices in Georgia were intended to profit at the expense of minority homeowners.

title: NEWS SUMMARY
description: International A3-14 CATHOLICS UPDATE TEACHINGS The Roman Catholic Church issued a new catechism for the first time in four centuries. The new version identifies a range of new sins that are products of modern-day society, including drunken driving, tax evasion and genetic engineering. A1 U.N. ACTS TO BLOCKADE SERBIA The Security Council voted to impose a naval blockade on the rump Yugoslavia. The decision adds enforcement provisions to trade sanctions it adopted against the Serbian-led Belgrade Government in May. A1

title: Digital Microwave reports earnings for Qtr to Sept 30
description: The company is listed on the Nasdaq National Market System.

description: Revenue represented patient revenues.The company is listed on the Nasdaq National Market System.
